component.name: debezium-mongodb
component.title: Debezium MongoDB Connector
component.description: Represents a Debezium MongoDB endpoint which is used to capture changes in MongoDB database so that that applications can see those changes and respond to them.
component.label: database,nosql,mongodb

additionalProperties.label: common
additionalProperties.description: Additional properties for debezium components in case they can't be set directly on the camel configurations (e.g: setting Kafka Connect properties needed by Debezium engine, for example setting KafkaOffsetBackingStore), the properties have to be prefixed with additionalProperties.. E.g: additionalProperties.transactional.id=12345&additionalProperties.schema.registry.url=http://localhost:8811/avro

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

configuration.description: Allow pre-configured Configurations to be set.

internalKeyConverter.label: consumer
internalKeyConverter.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize key data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

internalValueConverter.label: consumer
internalValueConverter.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize value data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

offsetCommitPolicy.label: consumer
offsetCommitPolicy.description: The name of the Java class of the commit policy. It defines when offsets commit has to be triggered based on the number of events processed and the time elapsed since the last commit. This class must implement the interface 'OffsetCommitPolicy'. The default is a periodic commit policy based upon time intervals.

offsetCommitTimeoutMs.label: consumer
offsetCommitTimeoutMs.description: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait for records to flush and partition offset data to be committed to offset storage before cancelling the process and restoring the offset data to be committed in a future attempt. The default is 5 seconds.

offsetFlushIntervalMs.label: consumer
offsetFlushIntervalMs.description: Interval at which to try committing offsets. The default is 1 minute.

offsetStorage.label: consumer
offsetStorage.description: The name of the Java class that is responsible for persistence of connector offsets.

offsetStorageFileName.label: consumer
offsetStorageFileName.description: Path to file where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the FileOffsetBackingStore.

offsetStoragePartitions.label: consumer
offsetStoragePartitions.description: The number of partitions used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the 'KafkaOffsetBackingStore'.

offsetStorageReplicationFactor.label: consumer
offsetStorageReplicationFactor.description: Replication factor used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore

offsetStorageTopic.label: consumer
offsetStorageTopic.description: The name of the Kafka topic where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

collectionBlacklist.label: consumer,mongodb
collectionBlacklist.description: Description is not available here, please check Debezium website for corresponding key 'collection.blacklist' description.

collectionWhitelist.label: consumer,mongodb
collectionWhitelist.description: The collections for which changes are to be captured

connectBackoffInitialDelayMs.label: consumer,mongodb
connectBackoffInitialDelayMs.description: The initial delay when trying to reconnect to a primary after a connection cannot be made or when no primary is available. Defaults to 1 second (1000 ms).

connectBackoffMaxDelayMs.label: consumer,mongodb
connectBackoffMaxDelayMs.description: The maximum delay when trying to reconnect to a primary after a connection cannot be made or when no primary is available. Defaults to 120 second (120,000 ms).

connectMaxAttempts.label: consumer,mongodb
connectMaxAttempts.description: Maximum number of failed connection attempts to a replica set primary before an exception occurs and task is aborted. Defaults to 16, which with the defaults for 'connect.backoff.initial.delay.ms' and 'connect.backoff.max.delay.ms' results in just over 20 minutes of attempts before failing.

databaseBlacklist.label: consumer,mongodb
databaseBlacklist.description: The databases for which changes are to be excluded

databaseHistoryFileFilename.label: consumer,mongodb
databaseHistoryFileFilename.description: The path to the file that will be used to record the database history

databaseWhitelist.label: consumer,mongodb
databaseWhitelist.description: The databases for which changes are to be captured

fieldBlacklist.label: consumer,mongodb
fieldBlacklist.description: Description is not available here, please check Debezium website for corresponding key 'field.blacklist' description.

fieldRenames.label: consumer,mongodb
fieldRenames.description: Description is not available here, please check Debezium website for corresponding key 'field.renames' description.

heartbeatIntervalMs.label: consumer,mongodb
heartbeatIntervalMs.description: Length of an interval in milli-seconds in in which the connector periodically sends heartbeat messages to a heartbeat topic. Use 0 to disable heartbeat messages. Disabled by default.

heartbeatTopicsPrefix.label: consumer,mongodb
heartbeatTopicsPrefix.description: The prefix that is used to name heartbeat topics.Defaults to __debezium-heartbeat.

initialSyncMaxThreads.label: consumer,mongodb
initialSyncMaxThreads.description: Maximum number of threads used to perform an initial sync of the collections in a replica set. Defaults to 1.

maxBatchSize.label: consumer,mongodb
maxBatchSize.description: Maximum size of each batch of source records. Defaults to 2048.

maxQueueSize.label: consumer,mongodb
maxQueueSize.description: Maximum size of the queue for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 8192, and should always be larger than the maximum batch size.

mongodbHosts.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbHosts.description: The hostname and port pairs (in the form 'host' or 'host:port') of the MongoDB server(s) in the replica set.

mongodbMembersAutoDiscover.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbMembersAutoDiscover.description: Specifies whether the addresses in 'hosts' are seeds that should be used to discover all members of the cluster or replica set ('true'), or whether the address(es) in 'hosts' should be used as is ('false'). The default is 'true'.

mongodbName.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbName.description: Unique name that identifies the MongoDB replica set or cluster and all recorded offsets, andthat is used as a prefix for all schemas and topics. Each distinct MongoDB installation should have a separate namespace and monitored by at most one Debezium connector.

mongodbPassword.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbPassword.description: Password to be used when connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

mongodbSslEnabled.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbSslEnabled.description: Should connector use SSL to connect to MongoDB instances

mongodbSslInvalidHostnameAllowed.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbSslInvalidHostnameAllowed.description: Whether invalid host names are allowed when using SSL. If true the connection will not prevent man-in-the-middle attacks

mongodbUser.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbUser.description: Database user for connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

pollIntervalMs.label: consumer,mongodb
pollIntervalMs.description: Frequency in milliseconds to wait for new change events to appear after receiving no events. Defaults to 500ms.

skippedOperations.label: consumer,mongodb
skippedOperations.description: The comma-separated list of operations to skip during streaming, defined as: 'i' for inserts; 'u' for updates; 'd' for deletes. By default, no operations will be skipped.

snapshotDelayMs.label: consumer,mongodb
snapshotDelayMs.description: The number of milliseconds to delay before a snapshot will begin.

snapshotFetchSize.label: consumer,mongodb
snapshotFetchSize.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while performing a snapshot

snapshotMode.label: consumer,mongodb
snapshotMode.description: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Options include: 'initial' (the default) to specify the connector should always perform an initial sync when required; 'never' to specify the connector should never perform an initial sync

sourceStructVersion.label: consumer,mongodb
sourceStructVersion.description: A version of the format of the publicly visible source part in the message

tombstonesOnDelete.label: consumer,mongodb
tombstonesOnDelete.description: Whether delete operations should be represented by a delete event and a subsquenttombstone event (true) or only by a delete event (false). Emitting the tombstone event (the default behavior) allows Kafka to completely delete all events pertaining to the given key once the source record got deleted.

name.label: consumer
name.description: Unique name for the connector. Attempting to register again with the same name will fail.

additionalProperties.label: common
additionalProperties.description: Additional properties for debezium components in case they can't be set directly on the camel configurations (e.g: setting Kafka Connect properties needed by Debezium engine, for example setting KafkaOffsetBackingStore), the properties have to be prefixed with additionalProperties.. E.g: additionalProperties.transactional.id=12345&additionalProperties.schema.registry.url=http://localhost:8811/avro

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

internalKeyConverter.label: consumer
internalKeyConverter.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize key data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

internalValueConverter.label: consumer
internalValueConverter.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize value data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

offsetCommitPolicy.label: consumer
offsetCommitPolicy.description: The name of the Java class of the commit policy. It defines when offsets commit has to be triggered based on the number of events processed and the time elapsed since the last commit. This class must implement the interface 'OffsetCommitPolicy'. The default is a periodic commit policy based upon time intervals.

offsetCommitTimeoutMs.label: consumer
offsetCommitTimeoutMs.description: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait for records to flush and partition offset data to be committed to offset storage before cancelling the process and restoring the offset data to be committed in a future attempt. The default is 5 seconds.

offsetFlushIntervalMs.label: consumer
offsetFlushIntervalMs.description: Interval at which to try committing offsets. The default is 1 minute.

offsetStorage.label: consumer
offsetStorage.description: The name of the Java class that is responsible for persistence of connector offsets.

offsetStorageFileName.label: consumer
offsetStorageFileName.description: Path to file where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the FileOffsetBackingStore.

offsetStoragePartitions.label: consumer
offsetStoragePartitions.description: The number of partitions used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the 'KafkaOffsetBackingStore'.

offsetStorageReplicationFactor.label: consumer
offsetStorageReplicationFactor.description: Replication factor used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore

offsetStorageTopic.label: consumer
offsetStorageTopic.description: The name of the Kafka topic where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

collectionBlacklist.label: consumer,mongodb
collectionBlacklist.description: Description is not available here, please check Debezium website for corresponding key 'collection.blacklist' description.

collectionWhitelist.label: consumer,mongodb
collectionWhitelist.description: The collections for which changes are to be captured

connectBackoffInitialDelayMs.label: consumer,mongodb
connectBackoffInitialDelayMs.description: The initial delay when trying to reconnect to a primary after a connection cannot be made or when no primary is available. Defaults to 1 second (1000 ms).

connectBackoffMaxDelayMs.label: consumer,mongodb
connectBackoffMaxDelayMs.description: The maximum delay when trying to reconnect to a primary after a connection cannot be made or when no primary is available. Defaults to 120 second (120,000 ms).

connectMaxAttempts.description: Maximum number of failed connection attempts to a replica set primary before an exception occurs and task is aborted. Defaults to 16, which with the defaults for 'connect.backoff.initial.delay.ms' and 'connect.backoff.max.delay.ms' results in just over 20 minutes of attempts before failing.

databaseBlacklist.description: The databases for which changes are to be excluded

databaseHistoryFileFilename.description: The path to the file that will be used to record the database history

databaseWhitelist.label: consumer,mongodb
databaseWhitelist.description: The databases for which changes are to be captured

fieldBlacklist.description: Description is not available here, please check Debezium website for corresponding key 'field.blacklist' description.

fieldRenames.description: Description is not available here, please check Debezium website for corresponding key 'field.renames' description.

heartbeatIntervalMs.description: Length of an interval in milli-seconds in in which the connector periodically sends heartbeat messages to a heartbeat topic. Use 0 to disable heartbeat messages. Disabled by default.

heartbeatTopicsPrefix.description: The prefix that is used to name heartbeat topics.Defaults to __debezium-heartbeat.

initialSyncMaxThreads.description: Maximum number of threads used to perform an initial sync of the collections in a replica set. Defaults to 1.

mongodbHosts.description: The hostname and port pairs (in the form 'host' or 'host:port') of the MongoDB server(s) in the replica set.

mongodbMembersAutoDiscover.description: Specifies whether the addresses in 'hosts' are seeds that should be used to discover all members of the cluster or replica set ('true'), or whether the address(es) in 'hosts' should be used as is ('false'). The default is 'true'.

mongodbPassword.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbPassword.description: Password to be used when connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

mongodbSslEnabled.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbSslEnabled.description: Should connector use SSL to connect to MongoDB instances

mongodbSslInvalidHostnameAllowed.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbSslInvalidHostnameAllowed.description: Whether invalid host names are allowed when using SSL. If true the connection will not prevent man-in-the-middle attacks

mongodbUser.label: consumer,mongodb
mongodbUser.description: Database user for connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

pollIntervalMs.description: Frequency in milliseconds to wait for new change events to appear after receiving no events. Defaults to 500ms.

skippedOperations.description: The comma-separated list of operations to skip during streaming, defined as: 'i' for inserts; 'u' for updates; 'd' for deletes. By default, no operations will be skipped.

snapshotDelayMs.label: consumer,mongodb
snapshotDelayMs.description: The number of milliseconds to delay before a snapshot will begin.

snapshotFetchSize.label: consumer,mongodb
snapshotFetchSize.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while performing a snapshot

snapshotMode.label: consumer,mongodb
snapshotMode.description: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Options include: 'initial' (the default) to specify the connector should always perform an initial sync when required; 'never' to specify the connector should never perform an initial sync
